channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dropped pavement causing flooding, 29th October
item.description:
Ongoing issue with dropped pavement outside property which causes flooding during bad weather, resident has had issue for 18 years and been reported numerous times and had repair recently couple years ago but issue is still ongoing JW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned SORN car on public road, 29th October
item.description:
A Mercedes silver car NX59UZG has been left on Sandy Road for more than 3 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Sandy Road, Northumberland Heath, Erith, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing road: parking restrictions, 29th October
item.description:
Many visitors and residents have been getting tickets for parking half on the pavement and half on the road. Fully parking on the road obstructs others from entering or leaving their driveway due to the narrowness of the road. Furthermore there are no road signs to advise whether people should park on the pavement or road as with adjacent streets nearby. Please could this issue be resolved ASAP as it's causing distress to us that have driveways being obstructed by people parking fully onto the road opposite us and people coming to visit their loved ones and meeting a ticket upon return to their cars. We would strongly advise for street signs to be placed onto the road advising for drivers to park half on the pavement and half on the road as is the case with roads adjacent to ours. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Detling Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste dumped by third party and street not swept every Wednesday, 29th October
item.description:
Since the street between my house and the mini roundabout is not swept by the Council every Wednesday, people dump their waste. I usually sweep the street and attempt to put the leaves, rubbish etc out with my waste. However, the Council refuses to remove it even though it is not my waste. It should not fall to me to sweep the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Farm Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No ramp on pavement for wheelchair users, 29th October
item.description:
There needs to be wheelchair ramp on both sides of this section of the pavement, for safe use for the disabled. I am in a wheelchair and partially blind, and i almost had an accident passing this section of the pavement. It is where the new Asda Express store is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 677, Green Lanes, Harringay, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding due to excess leaves and rubbish, 29th October
item.description:
On the middle carriageway opposite Dorchester Hotel there is a pedestrian walk, which floods after heavy rain, because of the amount of leaves and rubbish in the area. It has not been cleared for several months and the flooding causes issues for pedestrians using the crossing nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Curzon Square, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Angel Yard on corner of South Grove Highgate High Street, 29th October
item.description:
Due to the current road works - Highways have blocked the access and egress to Angel Yard, which is causing an issue for elderly residents who are also wheel chair bound and need to attend clinics. Please can access and egress be maintained at all times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, South Grove, Highgate, London
